alert.note: Alert for Northeast Bighorn Mountains; Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:56PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Sheridan County through 345 PM MDT... At 255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Sheridan, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail, along with brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Big Horn, Story and Banner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for north central Wyoming.
